summary: This is a U.S. government contract modification (P00001) issued to CACI, Inc. to de-obligate funds and officially close a contract for scanning and document management services related to the case 'U.S. v. Maxwell Epstein'. The original obligation was $26,639.04, but no payments were made, and the full amount is de-obligated.

events.title: Contract Period of Performance for Scanning Services
events.description: The period during which CACI, Inc. was to perform scanning and document management services for the U.S. v. Maxwell Epstein case under the original task order.

events.title: Contract Modification and Closure
events.description: Administrative modification issued to de-obligate all funds ($26,639.04) and officially close the scanning/document management contract for the Maxwell/Epstein case.

locations: U.S. Attorneys Office Southern District of New York, One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
CACI, INC. - COMMERCIAL, 14370 NEWBROOK DRIVE, CHANTILLY, VA 20151-4206
keyFacts: The U.S. government contracted with CACI, Inc. for scanning and document management services specifically for the case 'U.S. v. Maxwell Epstein'.
The contract was modified to de-obligate the full original amount of $26,639.04, indicating the services were either not performed or were funded through another mechanism.
The document references a specific task order (15JA5421F00000068) under a broader GSA schedule contract (GS-25F-0131M).
The period of performance for the scanning services was originally set from March 24, 2021, to May 31, 2021.
The contract was officially closed with a $0.00 current total obligation as of July 15, 2021.
